# isOn

**Instance Property**

A binding to a state property that indicates whether the toggle is on.

## Declaration

```swift
@Binding var isOn: Bool { get nonmutating set }
```

## Discussion

Because this value is a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Binding], you can both read and write it in your implementation of the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle/makeBody(configuration:)] method when defining a custom [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle]. Access it through that method’s `configuration` parameter.

Read this value to set the appearance of the toggle. For example, you can choose between empty and filled circles based on the `isOn` value:

```swift
Image(systemName: configuration.isOn
    ? "checkmark.circle.fill"
    : "circle")
```

Write this value when the user takes an action that’s meant to change the state of the toggle. For example, you can toggle it inside the `action` closure of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Button] instance:

```swift
Button {
    configuration.isOn.toggle()
} label: {
    // Draw the toggle.
}
```

## Managing the toggle state

- **isMixed**: Whether the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle] is currently in a mixed state.
- **$isOn**
